description.narrative: Revitalizing and strengthening role of the Local Communities - Mjesne Zajednice through enhancing local services and increasing democratic accountability and social inclusion

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative: Indicator 1: Select 20 local partner governments and 125 MZ Indicator 2: Conduct regional comparative review and develop vision of MZs Indicator 3: Number of MZs engaged in and contributing to the definition of a new vision for MZs in BiH. (2016) Indicator 4: Number of socio-economic stakeholders (disaggregated by sex), including socially excluded and vulnerable groups and women engaged in and contributing to the definition of a new vision for MZs in BiH. (2016). Indicator 5: Level of acceptance of the new vision for MZs by formally established consultative bodies. (2017) Indicator 6: % of citizens (disaggregated by sex) in selected partner municipalities familiar with the new MZ vision and willing to engage in its realization. (2017) Indicator 7: Number of MZs within target municipalities effectively engaged in local policy design and delivery cycle. (2017) Indicator 8: Number of MZs within target municipal governments which increase organizational and technical capacity. (2016 and 2017 and 2018) Indicator 9: Number of MZs with increased basic operating conditions. (2017 and 2018) Indicator 10: Number of CSOs and MZ activists who strengthen their knowledge and skills in local development and community strengthening. (2016, 2017 and 2018) Indicator 11: Number of citizen fora at the MZ level in target MZs and the number of directly engaged citizens. (2016, 2017 and 2018) Indicator 12: % of embedded MZ priorities acted on by municipalities.(2016,2017 and 2018) Indicator 13: Number of MZ proposed projects co-funded by the relevant municipalities and supported by the project. (2016, 2017, 2018) Indicator 14: Number of citizens directly and indirectly benefiting from access to and increased public services (disaggregated by sex and age). (2016, 2017 and 2018) Indicator 15: Number of citizens engaged in voluntary actions. (2017, 2018) Indicator 16: Number of women and people with disabilities benefiting from the implementation of the MZ and CSO projects. (2017, 2018) In

comment.narrative: Baseline 0: 0 (2014). Baseline 0a: 0 (2014). Baseline 1: 0 (2015). Baseline 2: 0 (2015). Baseline 3: Insufficient (2015). Baseline 4. 360 (2015). Baseline 13: 0 (2015). Baseline 14: 0 (2015). Baseline 15: 0 (2015). Baseline 16: 0 (2015). Baseline 17: 0 (2015). Baseline 18: 0 (2015). Baseline 19: 0 (2015). Baseline 20: 0 (2015). Baseline 21: 0 (2015).

1.Review local partner governments that are on probation period and finalize selection of local governments and adjoining MZ 2. Two Regional comparative review widely disseminated and four models of vision of MZs developed 3. 0 4. 0 5. The new vision is endorsed by legitimate bodies.40 % of citizens in selected 24 partner local governments contributing to realization of a new vision on the role of MZs 6. At least 136 MZs will continue to engage effectively in local policy design and delivery cycle 7. At least 136 MZs have an increase in organisational and technical capacity 8. 95% of participating MZ do have basic operational capacities 9. At least 700 CSO and MZ activists within target areas receive training or coaching by the end of 2018, including at least % women and 10% representatives of socially excluded groups 10. At least 136 MZ-level fora established bringing together at least 2,000 citizens (at least 40% women and at least 10% socially excluded groups) 11. At least 35% of embedded MZ priorities acted on by municipalities 12. At least 120 by 2019 13. At least 3,600 citizens (at least 40% women) benefit directly and at least 10,000 citizens (at least 40% women) benefit indirectly from improved access to and/or quality of public services as a result of project support by 2019 14. 2,500 by 2019 15 . 2,400 by 2019 16. 0 17. MZ network established and operational through at least two meetings 18. At least 136 19. Legal analysis and regulatory impact assessment conducted, target achieved 20. Models for statutes and decisions on MZ adopted by at least 15 local governments 21. Draft legislation prepared incorporating main principles and vision for MZ with strong recommendations for changes

1.Local partner governments in the process of finalizing incorporation of project outputs 2. Two Regional comparative review widely disseminated and four models of vision of MZs developed 3. 0 4. 0 5. The new vision is endorsed by l1. 24 local partner governments and 136 MZ 2. Achieved 3. 166 MZs which belongs to 84 LGs (out of 145 LGs in BiH) directly contributed in defining new MZ vision models 4. Activity completed through 1799 participants who directly (out of which 62% of men and 38% of women) took part in 22 vision setting meetings and final MZ Validation conference (December 2017). 5. Achieved, the new gender sensitive MZ vision has been verified by established institutions including project Board ministries and consulted with a wide range of government stakeholders at all levels. 6. At least 80% of citizens in selected partner municipalities are familiar with the MZ vision and are willing to engage in its realization. 7. There were at least 330 MZs in target municipalities effectively engaged in local policy design and 150 MZ in delivery cycle. 8. 136 MZs have increased their operational capacity. 9. 6% of all 136 partner MZs still lack basic operating capacity, due to remoteness of locations. 22 Community Hubs opened. 10. The Project in total trained in three years of implementation 4,728 individuals at 124 trainings sessions, 30% women. 11. In total, there were 606 citizens forums with 17,408 participants, 30 % women. 12. 704 priorities have been included in municipal work plan and the budgets. 13. In total, 331 MZ Projects are being co-funded by the local partner governments, 322 completed. 14. 322 MZ projects completed to the direct benefit of 308,986 citizens (42% women – 139,043). In addition, there were 627,336 indirect beneficiaries out of which 288,575 (46%) were women. 15. In total, number of citizens in target MZs engaged in voluntary actions was 27,496 citizens, out of which 30% women. 16. 35,259 citizens (9,525 women) and 3,604 socially excluded and vulnerable citizens benefiting from the implementation of the CSO projects. 17. Volume of financial resources attracted annually by CSOs in target areas for local initiatives as a result from successful project application to funding organisations is around 600,000 USD. 18. A formal Network of MZs officially established. The Network gathered 80 cross-entity members (LSG network coordinators) and held 3 official meetings. Through websites and social networks, events, all 136 MZs have been included. 19. Legal analysis and regulatory impact assessment conducted, and widely disseminated. 20. Model local government statute and decisions related to roles, rights, and responsibilities of MZ drafted through Legal Analysis. 22 local partner governments changed the and improved municipal statutes and decisions 21. Drafted changes and amendments to FBiH LPLSG and sent it to Parliamentary procedure. First draft legislation prepared incorporating main principles and vision for MZs in RS and recommendations for BD.egitimate bodies.40 % of citizens in selected 24 partner local governments contributing to realization of a new vision on the role of MZs 6. At least 136 MZs will continue to engage effectively in local policy design and delivery cycle 7. At least 136 MZs have an increase in organisational and technical capacity 8. 95% of participating MZ do have basic operational capacities 9. At least 700 CSO and MZ activists within target areas receive training or coaching by the end of 2018, including at least % women and 10% representatives of socially excluded groups 10. At least 136 MZ-level fora established bringing together at least 2,000 citizens (at least 40% women and at least 10% socially excluded groups) 11. At least 35% of embedded MZ priorities acted on by municipalities 12. At least 120 by 2019 13. At least 3,600 citizens (at least 40% women) benefit directly and at least 10,000 citizens (at least 40% women) benefit indirectly from improved access to and/or quality of public services as a result of project support by 2019 14. 2,500 by 2019 15 .2,400 by 2019 16.0 17. MZ network established and operational after at least 3 meetings 18. At least 136 19. Legal analysis and regulatory impact assessment conducted, target achieved 20. Models for statutes and decisions on MZs adopted by 16 local governments 21. Draft legislation prepared incorporating main principles and vision for MZ with strong recommendations for changes

1. 24 local partner governments and 136 MZ 2. Achieved 3. 166 MZs which belongs to 84 LGs (out of 145 LGs in BiH) directly contributed in defining new MZ vision models 4. Activity completed through 1799 participants who directly (out of which 62% of men and 38% of women) took part in 22 vision setting meetings and final MZ Validation conference (December 2017). 5. Achieved, the new gender sensitive MZ vision has been verified by established institutions including project Board ministries and consulted with a wide range of government stakeholders at all levels. 6. At least 80% of citizens in selected partner municipalities are familiar with the MZ vision and are willing to engage in its realization. 7. There were at least 330 MZs in target municipalities effectively engaged in local policy design and 150 MZ in delivery cycle. 8. 136 MZs have increased their operational capacity. 9. 6% of all 136 partner MZs still lack basic operating capacity, due to remoteness of locations. 22 Community Hubs opened. 10. The Project in total trained in three years of implementation 4,728 individuals at 124 trainings sessions, 30% women. 11. In total, there were 606 citizens forums with 17,408 participants, 30 % women. 12. 704 priorities have been included in municipal work plan and the budgets. 13. In total, 331 MZ Projects are being co-funded by the local partner governments, 322 completed. 14. 322 MZ projects completed to the direct benefit of 308,986 citizens (42% women – 139,043). In addition, there were 627,336 indirect beneficiaries out of which 288,575 (46%) were women. 15. In total, number of citizens in target MZs engaged in voluntary actions was 27,496 citizens, out of which 30% women. 16. 35,259 citizens (9,525 women) and 3,604 socially excluded and vulnerable citizens benefiting from the implementation of the CSO projects. 17. Volume of financial resources attracted annually by CSOs in target areas for local initiatives as a result from successful project application to funding organisations is around 600,000 USD. 18. A formal Network of MZs officially established. The Network gathered 80 cross-entity members (LSG network coordinators) and held 3 official meetings. Through websites and social networks, events, all 136 MZs have been included. 19. Legal analysis and regulatory impact assessment conducted, and widely disseminated. 20. Model local government statute and decisions related to roles, rights, and responsibilities of MZ drafted through Legal Analysis. 22 local partner governments changed the and improved municipal statutes and decisions 21. Drafted changes and amendments to FBiH LPLSG and sent it to Parliamentary procedure. First draft legislation prepared incorporating main principles and vision for MZs in RS and recommendations for BD.
